bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, November 20, 1952

div1.p: Hench informs Lawrence Reed that Blossom Reed has already replied to the Cuban invitation to attend the Camp Lazear dedication. Hench requests that he send a communique expressing the appreciation of the Reed family.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lawrence Reed, November 20, 1952
div1.opener:
November 20, 1952
General Walter Lawrence Reed
2810 Thirty-Sixth Place N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Reed:
div1.p:
Your sister has already written to the Cuban who
sent her the invitation for December 3. I wonder
whether, in addition to your direct letter of ack-
nowledgement, you would care to send either directly
to those concerned or through me, a telegraphic or
written communication expressing the appreciation
of yourself and your family, etc., not a burden-
some one, just a friendly word of greeting and
understanding.

Please see the encouraging news in my letter to
Mrs. Blossom.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
